ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2-3 hours per week when we had reading assignments
~2 for reading
Probably about 3 on average for weeks that we had readings.
1-2 depending upon the number of articles assigned

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It was a great course for intro into occupational epidemiology. The concepts are not necessarily straight forward so there was a lot of thinking and speculation involved. Something I did not like was that at the beginning of the semester we were told that the slides would be available on Classes V2 after the lectures so we would not have to sit there and copy all the slides, we could sit back and pay attention to what the lecturer was saying and take our own notes to add to the slides; then at the end of the semester we were told the slides would NOT be made available. It was extremely disappointing and confusing. I cannot remember the last class I had that refused to provide slides to the students.
could have involved more activity based/ case based learning in the class to get people to engage during certain lectures

I really enjoyed this course. It is very relaxed - There are no assignments, just a few readings each week, guest lecturers, and a take-home final. It is mainly participatory. Both professors were wonderful.
Excellent course for anyone interested in environmental/occupational medicine. Interactive course discussions based on clinically relevant articles. Final exam only-take home.
I loved this class. Both of the professors are amazing intellectuals and very knowledgeable in their fields. It was a pleasure to attend and I really hope to take classes with them in the future.
Class was very informative and engaging. Would make power points available in the future.
I really enjoyed the variety of subjects covered in the course. I especially loved the first hand anecdotes from the professors.
Great instructors. The guest lecturers were good. I really enjoyed this (elective) course.It would be nice to have access to lecture slides.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and responsive to students
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Great lecturer!
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Excellent teacher and motivator
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very knowledgeable and passionate about his lectures. Would love to have had physical copies of the information he covered in class.

Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Great professor! Very knowledgable and engaged with and enthusiastic about the course material. Dr. Russi was very good at getting input from the class when he asked questions and did a great job of reminding us of important epi concepts.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very good.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Very enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and responsive to students
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Very knowledgable about a broad range of topics
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Excellent instruction and attitude
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Very good speaker. Integrates humor well in his topics.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Great professor! Very engaged, enthusiastic, and approachable.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Very good.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Well-rounded experience with occ epi
Low work load and some very interesting topics, can be a nice addition to your schedule
I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in occupational health, or epidemiology in general.
Excellent and very relevant course.
Great course but notes should be provided.
Yes I would recommend this class.
